headline: Boeing 737 MAX victims' relatives ask judge to reject deal ending criminal case
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Relatives of some of the 346 people killed in two Boeing 737 MAX crashes in 2018 and 2019 asked a federal judge on Wednesday to reject a deal between the Justice Department and the planemaker that allows the company to avoid prosecution in a criminal fraud case.  The agreement enables Boeing to avoid being branded a convicted felon and to escape oversight from an independent monitor for three years that was part of a plea deal struck in 2024.  The families cited Judge Reed O'Connor's statement in 2023 that "Boeing's crime may properly be considered the deadliest corporate crime in U.S. history."

The agreement enables Boeing to avoid being branded a convicted felon and to escape oversight from an independent monitor for three years that was part of a plea deal struck in 2024.  The families cited Judge Reed O'Connor's statement in 2023 that "Boeing's crime may properly be considered the deadliest corporate crime in U.S. history."

headline: Boeing 787 Crash: What We Know and What Comes Next
summary: Boeing  stock was wavering on Wednesday as investors slowly pieced together what happened to the 787 jet that crashed in India almost a week ago.  Investigations are focused on the engines and why the plane lost lift shortly after takeoff.  Shares of the commercial jet maker were flat in premarket trading on Wednesday at $200.31 a share, while  and  futures were up 0.2% and 0.1%, respectively.

headline: BAE Systems partners with U.S. Army to advance capability upgrades to battle-proven M109 Paladin platform
summary: BAE Systems (LON: BA) partnered with the U.S. Army Combat Capabilities Development Command Armaments Center (DEVCOM-AC) to advance the M109-52 Self-Propelled Howitzer prototype. The Cooperative Research and Development Agreement (CRADA) ensures further development to provide options that enhance long range fires, enhance technology and improve artillery systems Soldiers are using in operations today.

headline: Airbus upbeat, but may have to wait for AirAsia deal
summary: PARIS (Reuters) -Airbus secured an order for 10 long-haul jets from Taiwan's Starlux Airlines on Wednesday, in a boost for the planemaker after AirAsia earlier played down the prospect of expected deals with Airbus or rival Embraer at the Paris Airshow.  Delegates have been braced for a muted show after Boeing struck huge deals during U.S. President Donald Trump's recent trip to the Middle East.  But Europe's Airbus has been steadily racking up business, and underscored its confidence about the future on Wednesday by holding out the prospect of higher dividends.

headline: Airbus to Lift Shareholder Returns as Demand for Aircraft Remains Strong
summary: Airbus said it would increase shareholder returns in the coming years, betting that strong demand for aircraft will continue to fuel growth.  The company said special dividends and share buybacks remained on the table to return extra cash to shareholders.  The announcement came during the Paris Air Show trade event where  Airbus  secured several aircraft orders, underscoring strong demand for planes as airlines continue to expand capacity.
